intro: Cephalomamillaria, commonly known as the star-shaped milkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apocynaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive, star-like flowers that are typically pink or white in color. The plant produces a milky sap, which is a common feature among members of its family. Cephalomamillaria is native to regions in South America, particularly in countries such as Brazil and Peru. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, well-drained soils.
